title: The footpath and highway:
author: Moran, Benjamin
snippet: No foreigners go to Portmoak, and I was probably the first that ever visited the place with the main purpose of seeing the poet's tomb.

title: The footpath and highway:
author: Moran, Benjamin
snippet: The way became more rugged and mountainous as I approached the highlands, and the heavy Scotch mists occasionally settled around me, but no rain fell, and after a walk of but little less than ten miles, I entered the secluded village of Portmoak and inquired for the sexton of the kirk.

title: The footpath and highway:
author: Moran, Benjamin
snippet: I left Edinburgh in the morning and proceeded to Granton Pier, from which place I crossed the Frith of Forth, and took rail to Markinch, the nearest station to Portmoak, the burial-place of Bruce.
